snippet.textDisplay: The most popular kingdom in the game, I'll always remember the reveal trailer with Mario coming out of the sewers. It felt like I was watching a GTA Mario game for a minute. Now that I played it, New Donk City may not be my favorite level but it certainly was memorable and ended with the amazing Festival. The jazz atmosphere was top notch thanks to this theme by Naoto Kubo who was promoted to Music Lead for the first time, and he certainly did well! Two things though: the humans in Odyssey are just weird and that jump-rope challenge was the worst part in the game.
snippet.textOriginal: The most popular kingdom in the game, I'll always remember the reveal trailer with Mario coming out of the sewers. It felt like I was watching a GTA Mario game for a minute. Now that I played it, New Donk City may not be my favorite level but it certainly was memorable and ended with the amazing Festival. The jazz atmosphere was top notch thanks to this theme by Naoto Kubo who was promoted to Music Lead for the first time, and he certainly did well! Two things though: the humans in Odyssey are just weird and that jump-rope challenge was the worst part in the game.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah, the most popular level, with amazing music and probably my second favorite moment in the game (after the ending): the festival. But it's not the best, I'd say. I prefer Luncheon Kingdom and Wooded Kindgom at least. And yeah, the jump rope.... Didn't even bother with that one.

@TerrorOfTalos  "i.e. NSMB series"
An obvious example of Nintendo not giving a hoot and overmilking the idea, yes. The Switch entry wasn't even a new attempt, just a port of the WiiU entry; sheesh, Nintendo.
Galaxy hasn't gotten there yet, LET THERE BE A THIRD GAME.
DO IT.

snippet.textDisplay: I've never really understood why so many people say they want Galaxy 3, is it just because of the space motif? Really it was just like any 3D Mario apart from that and a lot of the gravity type stuff has carried over into other Mario games since. Not sure what a 3rd game in that series would give you. I'd rather just have a new 3D Mario with a different mechanic and style
snippet.textOriginal: I've never really understood why so many people say they want Galaxy 3, is it just because of the space motif? I'd rather just have a new 3D Mario with a different mechanic and style
